ðŸŒŸ chandra | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Converting images and PDFs into structured, machine-readable formats while preserving layout.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Convert documents to markdown, html, or json with detailed layout information â€¢ Good handwriting support â€¢ Reconstructs forms accurately, including checkboxes â€¢ Good support for tables, math, and complex layouts â€¢ Extracts images and diagrams, with captions and structured data
ðŸ“– Summary: Chandra is an OCR model that converts images and PDFs into structured data formats like HTML, Markdown, or JSON, preserving layout information. It supports handwriting, forms, tables, math, and complex layouts, and offers both local (HuggingFace) and remote (vLLM server) inference modes.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ code-sandbox-mcp | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enabling AI assistants and LLM applications to safely execute code snippets.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Secure code execution in isolated containers â€¢ Support for Python and JavaScript code â€¢ Integration with Model Context Protocol (MCP) clients â€¢ Ability to pass environment variables to the sandbox â€¢ Support for custom container images
ðŸ“– Summary: The Code Sandbox MCP Server is a lightweight server that allows AI assistants and LLM applications to safely execute code snippets using containerized environments. It leverages the llm-sandbox package to execute code, supporting languages like Python and JavaScript, and returns the output and error streams to the client.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ leocad | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Designing and building virtual LEGO models.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Virtual LEGO model creation â€¢ Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, Linux, macOS) â€¢ OpenGL hardware acceleration for rendering â€¢ Parts Library support â€¢ Multiple installation methods on Linux (Snap, AppImage, Flatpak, Source)
ðŸ“– Summary: LeoCAD is a CAD (Computer-Aided Design) application specifically designed for creating virtual LEGO models. It offers a free and open-source solution for users to design and build LEGO creations on Windows, Linux, and macOS operating systems.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ every-pdf | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Desktop PDF editing, conversion, merging, and securing.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ PDF Editor â€¢ Convert PDF â€¢ Split Pages â€¢ Merge Files â€¢ Watermark
ðŸ“– Summary: The repository hosts Every PDF, a cross-platform desktop application built with Electron, Next.js, and Python. It provides a comprehensive toolkit for PDF editing, conversion, merging, and security, offering features ranging from basic document tasks to professional-level editing.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ lvgl | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating graphical user interfaces (GUIs) for embedded systems, including MCUs and MPUs.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Free and Portable (MIT License) â€¢ Written in C (C++ compatible) â€¢ No external dependencies â€¢ 30+ built-in Widgets â€¢ Flexible Style system
ðŸ“– Summary: LVGL is a free and open-source graphics library written in C, designed for creating embedded graphical user interfaces (GUIs) on microcontrollers (MCUs) and microprocessors (MPUs). It offers a wide range of widgets, styling options, and layout features, making it suitable for various display types and platforms with minimal resource requirements.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ SimpMusic | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Playing music from YouTube Music on Android devices with added features like ad-blocking, offline playback, and synced lyrics.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Play music from YouTube Music or YouTube without ads â€¢ Browse Home, Charts, Podcast, Moods & Genre with YouTube Music data â€¢ Search everything on YouTube
ðŸ“– Summary: SimpMusic is a free and open-source Android music player that utilizes YouTube Music as its backend. It offers features like ad-free background playback, browsing YouTube Music content, offline playback, synced lyrics, and support for SponsorBlock and Return YouTube Dislike, aiming to provide a comprehensive music listening experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ duelr | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Evaluating and comparing LLM responses across different providers based on latency, cost, and quality metrics.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Parallel Comparison â€¢ Comprehensive Metrics â€¢ Quality Scoring â€¢ Cost Transparency â€¢ Extensible
ðŸ“– Summary: Duelr is an open-source tool for comparing the performance and quality of different Large Language Models (LLMs). It allows users to test multiple LLMs simultaneously, tracking metrics like latency, token usage, cost, and quality scores for length simplicity, readability, and JSON validity, facilitating informed decisions about LLM selection.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ ssh-bot | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Executing commands on and managing files on remote hosts via Telegram.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Executing commands in local or remote (via SSH) environment â€¢ Output streaming for long-running commands â€¢ Pseudo-terminal (PTY) support for interactive programs â€¢ Ability to forcibly stop running remote commands â€¢ Support for parallel (asynchronous) command execution
ðŸ“– Summary: The ssh-bot is a Telegram bot written in Go that allows users to execute commands on remote hosts via SSH. It supports features like persistent SSH connections, real-time output streaming, PTY support, SFTP for file management, and dynamic host management, providing a convenient alternative to VPNs and dedicated SSH clients.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
